UART Stream Functionality
mcu » apollo330P

Detailed Description

Purpose: This module provides UART streaming mode hardware abstraction for Apollo5 devices, supporting high-speed data streaming, DMA transfers, and interrupt-driven communication. It enables efficient UART data transfer with minimal CPU overhead for continuous data streaming.

Key Features

  1. Streaming Mode: High-speed continuous data streaming support.
  2. DMA Transfer: Efficient DMA-based data transfer operations.
  3. Interrupt Driven: Interrupt-based data handling and processing.
  4. FIFO Management: Advanced FIFO handling and buffer management.
  5. Power Management: Power state control and retention capabilities.

Functionality

  • Initialize and configure UART streaming mode
  • Handle DMA-based data transfer operations
  • Manage FIFO buffers and data flow
  • Support interrupt-driven data processing
  • Control power states and retention

Usage

  1. Initialize UART streaming using am_hal_uart_stream_initialize()
  2. Configure streaming parameters and DMA settings
  3. Set up interrupt handlers for data processing
  4. Handle streaming data transfer operations
  5. Manage power states as needed

Configuration

  • Streaming Parameters: Configure streaming mode settings
  • DMA Settings: Set up DMA transfer configurations
  • FIFO Management: Configure FIFO buffer parameters
  • Interrupts: Set up interrupt sources and handlers

◆ am_hal_uart_stream_dma_rx_descriptor_entry_t

typedef struct uart_dma_rx_qe am_hal_uart_stream_dma_rx_descriptor_entry_t

defines a rx buffer descriptor used for DMA transmissions in the streaming functions The DMA does not require an aligned start address This is part of the stream state

◆ am_hal_uart_stream_dma_tx_descriptor_entry_t

typedef struct uart_dma_tx_qe am_hal_uart_stream_dma_tx_descriptor_entry_t

defines a tx buffer descriptor used for DMA transmissions in the streaming functions The DMA does not require an aligned start address This is part of the stream state

◆ am_hal_uart_interrupt_stream_service()

am_hal_uart_stream_status_t am_hal_uart_interrupt_stream_service ( void * pUartHandle)

Manage UART ISR used when using uart streaming api This is a nonblocking, non-signaling (streaming) uart driver, it saves incoming rx data in the rx queue, and transmits tx data from the queue via fifo with interrupts or DMA.

Note
This takes care of all interrupt management, the calling application does not interact with the processor interrupts.
Parameters
pUartHandlePointer to the UART handle
Returns
am_hal_uart_stream_status_t

◆ am_hal_uart_stream_configure_tx()

am_hal_uart_errors_t am_hal_uart_stream_configure_tx ( void * pUartHandle,
const am_hal_uart_stream_tx_config_t * ptxConfig )

configure the streaming driver for TX operation

Parameters
pUartHandlePointer to the UART handle
ptxConfigpointer to pre-defined struct containing tx config params
Returns
AM_HAL_UART_STATUS_SUCCESS if the configuration is successful. Returns a UART error code (am_hal_uart_errors_t) if an error is detected during RX or TX stream configuration.

◆ am_hal_uart_stream_data_configure()

am_hal_uart_errors_t am_hal_uart_stream_data_configure ( void * pUartHandle,
const am_hal_uart_stream_data_config_t * psDataCfg )

Configures UART streaming data settings for a specified module.

This sets up the UART streaming data configurations, including RX and TX streaming configurations.

Parameters
pUartHandlePointer to the UART handle
psDataCfgPointer to the UART streaming data config struct. (am_hal_uart_stream_data_config_t) Which contains setup settings, including stream configurations for RX and TX.
Returns
AM_HAL_UART_STATUS_SUCCESS if the configuration is successful. Returns a UART error code (am_hal_uart_errors_t) if an error is detected during RX or TX stream configuration.

◆ am_hal_uart_stream_enable_rxDma()

am_hal_uart_errors_t am_hal_uart_stream_enable_rxDma ( void * pUartHandle,
bool bEnableRxDMA,
bool bClearFifo )

Enables or disables RX DMA streaming for a specified UART module.

This function configures the RX DMA settings of a UART module to enable or disable RX DMA streaming. It clears the UART FIFO buffer if requested, It sets up DMA buffers, and initializes RX DMA if enabled.

Parameters
pUartHandlePointer to the UART streaming state structure (am_hal_uart_stream_state_t). This structure contains the state of the UART streaming and DMA configurations.
bEnableRxDMABoolean flag to specify whether to enable (true) or disable (false) RX DMA streaming.
bClearFifoBoolean flag to indicate whether to clear the RX FIFO buffer. Set this to 'true' to clear the buffer before enabling RX DMA streaming.
Returns
AM_HAL_UART_STATUS_SUCCESS if the RX DMA is successfully enabled or disabled. Other UART-specific error codes (am_hal_uart_errors_t) in case of a failure,

◆ am_hal_uart_stream_get_num_rx_bytes_in_buffer()

uint32_t am_hal_uart_stream_get_num_rx_bytes_in_buffer ( void * pUartHandle,
bool bUnloadRxFifo )

get number of bytes in rx buffer

Note
Using this function only makes sense when not using RX DMA as the uart driver has no visibility of much data the RX buffer contains as DMA transfers are ongoing. Use the RX callback mechanism for RX DMA
. This function won't include any bytes sitting in the RX FIFO
Parameters
pUartHandlePointer to the UART handle
bUnloadRxFifowhen any data in the fifo will be unloaded first
Returns
The number of bytes loaded into the rx buffer

◆ am_hal_uart_stream_get_rx_data()

uint32_t am_hal_uart_stream_get_rx_data ( void * pUartHandle,
uint8_t * pui8DestBuff,
uint32_t ui32MaxBytesToRead,
bool bUnloadRxFifo )

Get Rx Data from Streaming buffered data This function will unload data from the queue and load the data into a user supplied buffer.

Parameters
pUartHandlePointer to the UART handle
pui8DestBuffPointer to rx data buffer
ui32MaxBytesToReadmax number of bytes to read
bUnloadRxFifowhen true, the function will first unload any data in the rx fifo
Returns
number of bytes loaded into data buffer

◆ am_hal_uart_stream_initialize()

uint32_t am_hal_uart_stream_initialize ( uint32_t ui32Module,
void ** ppUartHandle )

Handle init function.

Initializes a UART stream instance for a specified module.

Note
The provided am_hal_uart_stream_state_t instance cannot not be NULL. It cannot be a stack variable, it must be a pointer to a global.

This function sets up initial configurations and internal states for the specified UART module. It ensures that the requested module is valid and not already initialized before associating it with the provided UART stream state structure.

Parameters
ui32ModuleThe UART module number to initialize. Must be less than the total number of UART modules supported.
ppUartHandlePointer uart handle pointer the pointer is set in this function
Returns
AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS if the initialization is successful. AM_HAL_STATUS_INVALID_ARG if the module number is invalid. AM_HAL_STATUS_INVALID_OPERATION if the module is already initialized.

◆ am_hal_uart_stream_interrupt_clr_set()

uint32_t am_hal_uart_stream_interrupt_clr_set ( void * pUartHandle,
uint32_t ui32Clear,
uint32_t ui32Set )

This function will set and clear interrupt enable bits for the specified uart.

Parameters
pUartHandlePointer to the UART streaming state handle
ui32Clearthese bits will be cleared in the uart interrupt enable register
ui32Setthese bits will be set in the uart interrupt enable register
Returns
AM_HAL_STATUS_SUCCESS always success
